summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene and toluene are both listed as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) monitored in the Scheldt estuary over a three-year period. They are part of a broader study on the occurrence and variability of priority hazardous substances in the environment. However, there is no specific discussion of their interactions, effects, or comparative significance within the study, indicating a lack of direct relationship between the two compounds.
